page.title: 11Council Housing.
page.content: In{2868 and 2968,}apart from old Gilmerton village,virtually all the other housing is fairly recent dating mainly from the{195O's and 60s.} Counicl housing schemes were built to house people from condemned inner-city housing. Building styles include;- (a)semi-detached houses (b)two-storey terraces of four houses (c)low-rise flats,4 or 5 storeys high. The short terraces blocks and semis have gardens front and back,but no provision was made for garages when they were built.Each block of flats houses approximately{2O}families. In recent years many families have opted to buy their houses from the council.Some small private housing schemes have developed.Houses are being built by "Laing"in a small estate just east of Drum Street.
